recipe.title: Cookbook:Carrot Salad
recipe.description: *Fresh greens like matzumi or baby Chinese mustard, or even Boston lettuce (optional) *Chives (optional)
ingredients: White balsalmic vinegar (or a mix of two parts red wine vinegar to one part balsamic vinegar)
Fresh greens like matzumi or baby Chinese mustard, or even Boston lettuce (optional)
instructions: Julliene the carrots (or grate them if julienning is not feasible).
Coat with about 1–2 tablespoons of almond oil.
Sprinkle generously with vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Add a hefty serving of pine nuts.
notes: Carrot salad wrapped in greens: Place a little bit of the carrot salad on a green leaf and wrap it up, tying it with a chive. They make about 2-bite hors d'œuvres that are light, healthy, and surprisingly filling. If you can get a-hold of the young mustard greens, they add a fantastic spiciness to it that can't be matched.
